Inside Macintosh: Operating System Utilities /
Chapter 1 - Gestalt Manager / Gestalt Manager Reference

Gestalt Manager Routines

This section describes the three Gestalt Manager functions, Gestalt, NewGestalt, and ReplaceGestalt. It also describes the SysEnvirons function, which can give you a brief description of the operating environment when Gestalt is not available. The Gestalt Manager functions allow you to

  • find out what hardware and software features are present
  • add new selectors to those understood by the Gestalt function
  • replace the functions associated with known selectors

Subtopics
Getting Information About the Operating Environment
Adding a Selector Code
Modifying a Selector Function
